Articles.Content:
Hey all,

With the release of 1.0.3, I think that I am going to get back into KSP (it's been honestly a few months now).

My question is this: I used to use [KSP Mod Admin](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/26031-AnyOS-KSP-Mod-Admin-v2-Mod-install-with-a-few-clicks). It worked well enough. I also have heard of [CKAN](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100067-The-Comprehensive-Kerbal-Archive-Network-%28CKAN%29-Package-Manager)and [Tinker Time](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/85865-Tinker-Time-Self-Updating-Curse-com-Mod-Manager-for-KSP).

What mod manager do *you* like? Why? What are the pros and cons of each?

Thanks and happy landings!
I generally prefer CKAN, as it supports automatic handling of dependencies (i.e. if a mod you're interested in requires another mod, the second mod is also automatically installed).
I think I'll give CKAN a try first. Thanks!
